snippet: The bus hit the 70-year-old woman, Carol Bell, early Tuesday morning and continued on to a nearby depot after stopping briefly, the authorities said.
abstract: New York City authorities announce Metropolitan Transportation Authority bus driver Paul Roper was arrested for colliding with 70-year-old Carol Bell in Brooklyn and killing her; Roper, who has driven city bus for 15 years, has been charged with leaving scene of accident among other charges.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN MUELLER and NATE SCHWEBER
byline.contributor: Emma G. Fitzsimmons contributed reporting, and Susan C. Beachy contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The bus hit the 70-year-old woman, Carol Bell, early Tuesday morning and continued on to a nearby depot after stopping briefly, the authorities said.

headline.main: M.T.A. Bus Fatally Strikes Woman in Brooklyn; Driver Is Arrested
headline.print_headline: Driver Arrested After Bus Fatally Strikes Pedestrian
